task.title: Prepare Wiring Components
task.shortdesc: Cut, strip, label, and tin all wires and components before soldering the circuit together.

prereq.p: You need a soldering iron heated to 650-700Â°F, wire cutters, wire stripper, permanent marker, electrical tape, and all circuit components.

context.p: Complete all wire preparation before you begin soldering. This makes assembly faster and helps prevent wiring mistakes.

step.cmd: Identify the pickup hot and ground wires.

choices.choice:
If your pickup has two wires (2-conductor):
Black wire is hot
White wire is ground

If your pickup has four wires (4-conductor):
Black wire is hot
Yellow or green wire is ground

info.note: For 4-conductor pickups: Solder the two unused wires together and wrap them with electrical tape. Unwrapped wires cause noise and weak sound.

step.cmd: Orient both potentiometers with the shafts facing down and lugs facing up.
step.info: Position lug 3 on the left side of each potentiometer.

step.cmd: Label one potentiometer casing "V" for volume and the other "T" for tone.
step.info: Use a permanent marker on the back of the casings. Either potentiometer can serve as volume or tone.

step.cmd: Cut and strip four connection wires.

substep.cmd: Cut two 3.5-inch black wires and two 3.5-inch red wires from your stranded wire spool.
Strip 1/4 inch of insulation from each end of all four wires.

step.cmd: Prepare the jumper wire from solid core wire.

substep.cmd: Strip 1 inch of insulation from the end of the solid core wire spool.
Cut the stripped section in half to create a 0.5-inch bare wire.
Apply a thin coat of solder to the stripped ends of the four connection wires.
Apply a thin coat of solder to both ends of the 0.5-inch jumper wire.
Apply a thin coat of solder to the pickup hot and ground wire ends.

step.info: Tinning coats the wire with solder, making it easier to create strong solder joints.

step.cmd: Trim the capacitor leads to 0.5 inches if they are longer.

result.p: All components are prepared and ready for soldering.
